reviews.text: Clean, ok priced, but extremely loud! Staff not the friendliest in the world and services are basic. This hotel is very strange! It's rooms literally look the entrance of the cable car! The entire hotel shakes every time there is a cable car arrival / departure (that is all the time except some hours during the night).
reviews.title: Overlooks cable car - too noisy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Definitely will not go back and will not recommend it.
reviews.title: A Lousy Nights Sleep

reviews.text: This hotel is close to town but the Funicular runs 5 AM to 12:00 midnight which shakes the hotel and is loud. The hotel has no air conditioning and the open windows front on a large square which has lots of bars/restaurants. If nightlife is your thing it's great but a good nights sleep is iffy.
reviews.title: No frills but clean and convenient.

reviews.text: Stayed for one night. Got a room above funicular, so a bit noisy but wanted an a/c room, and this was the only one available. Walking distance to lake and restaurants. Lady at reception was pleasant and helpful. Clean room and bathroom, although small, but then we have come to expect that everywhere in Europe. Very practical for short stays especially if traveling by train to other destinations as funicular takes one right inside the train station in 40 seconds and is right next to hotel.
reviews.title: Central, spotless clean, good service, internet - great for business stay

reviews.text: Stayed at the hotel for one night during the business trip. Perfect central location next to shops and Manor store. Next to funicular -if you want a quiet early night or stay longer ask for a quiet room. Modern functional room. Was impressed by spotless clean everything, nice bed and sheets. Lovely helpful staff. The Internet connection is great and costs a minimal amount. Coming from Britain I did not have the Swiss adapter- the hotel lent me one for free for whole stay- just perfect.
reviews.title: Like being next to a mini rocket launch facility

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Recently stayed one night here when passing through Lugano. Found it a convenient, reasonably priced (for the area) place to stay. The funicular did not bother us that much; for those sensitive to noise, it may not work. Weather was mild when we were there, and a very quiet table fan was a nice breeze. Room was very basic, no frills, basic TV, but that's all we needed. Shower was tiny but good. Towels/toiletries were cheap, but for one night, no problem, we used our own toiletries. Breakfast not included, so we walked to McDonald's for cappuccinos and rolls. The location is great, just down steps (or funicular) from train station. We didn't know about the funicular so got slightly confused finding the hotel at first, but the location is super-convenient to lakefront, sights of Lugano, plus easy access back to the train station, all walking.
reviews.title: Good for short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this hotel is very good as it is close to the station and central to the town and the lake. It is worth paying more to get away from the funicular (the hotel is built around it). Breakfast was 14 euros each which was costly on top of an expensive room. The room was comfortable and the staff were helpful.
reviews.title: Beware the Funicular, Helpful staff

reviews.text: So we booked this hotel, which had a perfect location, a few steps from Piazza Riforma and the lake. As we were going to arrive quite late, we called the reception to let them know, and we did well, as they close the reception and give you a passcode to open the entrance door. Your room is open, and the key can be found on the bed. I found this solution interesting and original.
reviews.title: Cheap but not so cheerful

reviews.text: Basic hotel. Clean room. Left the - Do not disturb sign on the door but they still came in and did the room which I found really annoying.

reviews.text: Acquarello is a convenient hotel with clean, modern, basic rooms which is centrally located amongst some nice shops and restaurants. Glitzy dated sign, a basic reception and bar. Perfect location for the early morning train to Luzern. Pay a little more so your room is not too close to the noisy funicular which stops about 11pm and starts about 6am.
This hotel could be so much more....
